news.title: How the stock market made it back to a new record — even with so much still to worry about
news.summary: The wall of worry has been crumbling with trade deals in motion and the economy remaining in solid shape. The economy is in good shape and the Wall of worry is crumbling.

news.title: Pixar's 'Elio' is emblematic of a bigger headwind for Hollywood
news.summary: "Elio" had a record low opening for the studio. Its performance is emblematic of a much wider trend in Hollywood: a reliance on sequels.

news.title: Trump Organization scraps 'made in the USA' tag for its gold T1 smartphone
news.summary: The Trump Organization has removed a reference to the recently-announced T1 smartphone being made in America. The T1 is a new smartphone from the Trump Organization. It is expected to go on sale later this year.

news.title: PayPal teams up with the Big Ten and Big 12 to enable payments to student-athletes
news.summary: PayPal will allow student-athletes to receive their compensation via the fintech company. A new partnership between the Big Ten and Big 12 conferences and PayPal.

news.title: Trump administration moves to count crypto as a federal mortgage asset
news.summary: The Trump administration is ordering Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to formally consider cryptocurrency as an asset in single-family mortgage loan risk assessments. The move is aimed at reducing the risk of a mortgage default.

news.title: My son, 39, will be released from prison in 2030. Do I leave him my $100K life insurance?
news.summary: “I am concerned about leaving a large sum of cash to a drug user,” she says. “I’m concerned about people using the money to buy drugs.”

news.title: This outlook shows why investors should maintain exposure to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
news.summary: Big Tech is expected to see double the earnings growth of the S&P 500, as long as the group can maintain momentum in a key area.

news.title: Your Social Security check will be nearly 20% less if Congress doesn’t face facts soon
news.summary: America’s retirement trust fund is expected to run dry by 2034. A U.S. economic downturn would only make a bad situation worse.

news.title: ‘I’m 68 and my 401(k) has dwindled to $82,000’: My husband committed financial infidelity and has $50,000 in credit-card debt. What now?
news.summary: “I have $3,000 in gold and Social Security income for me and my spouse makes $46,180 a year.”

news.title: Walgreens’ U.S. retail sales remain weak, but here’s why the stock is rising
news.summary: The drugstore industry is facing competition from the likes of Amazon.com Inc., as well as pressure on pharmacy-reimbursement rates for prescription drugs.
